initial.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The initial response has been encouraging.
the initial stages of the disease
initial.translation[1].definitions[0].de: the first letter of someone’s first name
initial.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: ‘Can I have your initial, Mr Davies?’ ‘It’s G, Mr G Davies.’
initial.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to write your initials on a document to make it official or to show that you agree with something
initial.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The two countries have initialled a new defence co-operation agreement.
initial.translation[3].definitions[0].de: happening first or at the beginning of an event or process
initial.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Each portfolio has a minimum initial investment of $3,000.
the initial capital required for the project  (=the money needed to start it)
Somatogen sold two million shares in its initial public offering (=when its shares were made available to the public for the first time).
initial.translation[4].definitions[0].de: to write your initials on an official document to show that you agree with it
initial.translation[4].definitions[0].ex: I would be grateful if you could complete and initial clause two, and return the documents to us.
initial.translation[4].definitions[1].de: to make an official written agreement or arrangement with someone
initial.translation[4].definitions[1].ex: Seoul and Beijing initialed a trade agreement in a move to expand economic exchanges between the two nations.
initial.translation[5].definitions[0].de: the first letter of someone’s first name
initial.translation[5].definitions[0].ex: I need a list of names, with initials.
initial.translation[5].definitions[1].de: the first letters of the words in the name of a company or organization, or the first letters of all someone’s names
initial.translation[5].definitions[1].ex: Yves Saint Laurent’s famous initials, YSL
